describe: The Netherlands, located in Northwestern Europe, is known for its flat landscape, extensive canal systems, tulip fields, windmills, and cycling routes. It is a constitutional monarchy with a rich cultural heritage and a strong emphasis on art, history, and innovation.

cities.name: üèô Amsterdam
cities.geographical_location: Located in the western part of the Netherlands, Amsterdam is the capital city and is situated on the banks of the Amstel River.
cities.climate: Amsterdam has an oceanic climate, with mild summers and cool winters, and frequent rainfall throughout the year.

cities.name: üèô Rotterdam
cities.geographical_location: Located in the province of South Holland, Rotterdam is a major port city in the Netherlands.
cities.climate: Rotterdam experiences a temperate oceanic climate, with mild temperatures and moderate rainfall.

cities.name: üèù The Hague
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the western coast of the Netherlands, The Hague is the seat of the Dutch government and the royal family.
cities.climate: The Hague has a temperate maritime climate, with cool summers and mild winters.

cities.name: üåÜ Utrecht
cities.geographical_location: Located in the central Netherlands, Utrecht is known for its medieval old town and vibrant cultural scene.
cities.climate: Utrecht has a temperate oceanic climate, with moderate rainfall and mild temperatures.
